episode_title: 709 - The One With All The Candy

content.description: Central Park, Ross is teaching Ben how to ride a bike. Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there also.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: I’m ready!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You sure?

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, let me just straighten out your helmet there. (Does so.)

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Thanks daddy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, one daddy, two mommies . All right, it’s all yours. (Ross pushes him off.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! Yes! Yes!! (Everyone stands and claps.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: His first big kid’s bike, this is so exciting!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, I remember mine! Ohh, it was my sixth birthday, my dad took me to the park, I got it, and…it bent.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I never had a bike of my own.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, we didn’t have a lot of money. But the girl across the street had the best bike! It was pink and it had rainbow colored tassels hanging off the handle grips, and-and-and a bell and this big , white wicker basket with those plastic daisies stuck on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That sounds like my first bike. (They all turn and look at him.) My dad gave me his old one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did the girl ever let you ride it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! But she gave me the box that it came in. It had a picture of the bike on the front. (They’re all speechless) So I would sit on it and my step-dad would drag me around the backyard.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is so unfair!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not really, I got to drag him around too! (They all nod, “Oh.”)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is cooking, Joey is eating, and Chandler is entering from the bedroom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! What are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Making holiday candy for the neighbors.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry, who?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna hang this basket (Points to the one sitting on the table) on the door and when the neighbors walk by they can all take a piece.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But we don’t know the neighbors.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I do. There’s uh, let’s see, Guy With a Mustache, Smokes-A-Lot Lady, Some Kids I’ve Seen, and A Red-haired Guy Who Does Not Like To Be Called Rusty.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See? This is exactly why I’m making this candy. We can learn their names and get to know our neighbors.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wouldn’t it be easier if we just moved?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gooood morning!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh, somebody’s in a good mood!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, why shouldn’t I be? I have great friends! I have a wonderful job!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where you can make out with your assistant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, it’s not a big deal! We stayed up all night coming up with a plan so that us dating will not be a problem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, what’s the plan?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We… We are not… …going to let it… be a problem.
content.parenthetical: pauses as she thinks and exhales loudly

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! It took you all night to come up with that plan?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know, we did other stuff too. (Joey and Chandler start to giggle.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you two…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Monica come on, y’know I don’t sleep with guys on the first date!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Matt Guire, Mark Lynn, Ben Wire…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anymore!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Rachel’s Office, she’s at her desk while the mailman delivers her mail and calls Tag in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. Tag, I have a conference call today is that correct?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yes, at 4:00.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, thank you. That’ll be all. (The mail guy leaves and Tag starts to follow, but Rachel stops him.) (Excitedly) Wait! Wait! (Rushes over and closes the office-door.) Did you see that? That mail guy had no idea there was something going on between us. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I’d better get back to my desk.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you hard worker! I’ll remember to put that in your evaluation.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: My what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you’ve been here for two months now and your boss is required to hand in a performance evaluation. But y’know, there is one thing that I have yet to evaluate. (She turns around and sweeps the stuff off of her desk and hops up onto it.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I’ve just always wanted to do that. Can you help me clean this up?

content.description: The Hallway, Monica and Chandler are returning and Monica finds her basket is empty.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The basket is totally empty! My God, the neighbors ate all the candy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, either that or uh…(Motions towards Joey’s door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!!
(She storms into his apartment to find him with a towel around his shoulders, a bowl on his head, and Phoebe with scissors in her hand.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you eat all the neighbor candy?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh well yeah, that was the plan, but by the time I got to it there was only a couple of pieces left!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and they’ve been coming by all day. They love it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They love my candy? Oh man!!! I’ve gotta go make more!! (Starts to do so.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Mon, you might wanna make some more lasagna too, because something might’ve happened to a huge chunk of it.
(Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross! The neighbors ate all my candy!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mine stole my newspaper! It’s like a crime wave!! (Monica runs to make more candy.) Pheebs, you uh, you got a second.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, ever since you uh, told me that story about that bike I-I couldn’t stop thinking about it. I mean, everyone should have a-a first bike, so…
(He goes out into the hall and re-enters with a bike exactly like the one Phoebe described earlier.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God Ross!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You like it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I love it!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh!! Ohh!! And I love you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not that way! But the bike brought you a lot closer!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah! (She hugs him.) Well uh-uh, t-take it downstairs, y’know give it a test ride.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! Oh my God! My first bike! Thank you for the best present I’ve ever gotten.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh and Chandler’s about to cry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Am not!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, the middle of the night, there is someone knocking on the door and Monica and Chandler get up to answer it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who is that?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t worry, I’m brave! I am brave! I…I am brave! (They get to the door and Monica goes to open it.) No-no-no-no!! (He stops her.) (Through the door.) Can you tell me who is there please?

content.speaker: The Knocker
content.text: My name is Gary, I live upstairs.
(Monica opens the door.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. Do you know what time it is?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: It’s candy time! My roommate says that they taste like little drops of heaven.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh please! (To Chandler) Did you hear that? Little drops of heaven.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: So, can I get some candy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am sorry, but some of us have to get up early and go to work! (Monica looks at him) (To Monica) He does not know that I am not some of us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, listen I am sorry, but I’ll put some out first thing in the morning.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Well okay, I’ll swing by later. Do you live in this building?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Mm! Seems like I would’ve remembered you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mm! Night Gar’! (Monica closes the door.)

content.description: Rachel’s Office, she’s slinking out to where Tag works and checks to make sure no one is coming.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So did you read your evaluation yet?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: No! It was marked confidential, I just sent it down to Human Resources.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay please, you’re kidding right?! I wrote that one as a joke for you!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: A joke they would appreciate?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m thinkin’ no.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What did you say?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, I said I thought you were a good kisser, and uh, and that I like your tiney-tiny tushie.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: No, not my tushie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it gets worse. When asked if you take initiative I wrote, “Yes, he was able to unhook my bra with minimal supervision,” and under Problems with Performance I wrote, “Dear God, I hope not,” and then uh, then I drew a little smiley face, and then a small pornographic sketch.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Monica, Ross, and Chandler are watching Phoebe polish the daisies on her bike outside.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross! That is so sweet of you to get Phoebe that bike! When I heard the story, I almost cried.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Almost cried huh? Hear that Chandler? Almost cried!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you cry every time somebody talks about Titanic !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Those two only had each other!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe really likes the bike huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah! I saw her walkin’ it down the street the other day. She had uh, these flowers in the basket. It was so cute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I saw her this morning walkin’ it by the park.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, she was walking the bike? Both times?
[Cut to outside, they’re going to talk to Phoebe about walking the bike.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! So are you enjoying the bike?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, uh-huh so much!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs you uh…you do know how to ride a bike don’t you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Of course!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, can we see you ride it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (The gang is giggles then as Phoebe gets the bike out of the rack, gets on, pushes off, rolls a few feet, and falls over.) See?

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is making candy while Chandler and Rachel are taste-testing and Joey is on the couch doodling.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See, this is why I told you never get involved with your assistant! And there is no such thing as keeping secrets when it comes to affairs. (To Chandler) Did you hear that Chandler? No such thing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What happened? I’m just eating candy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe it’s not as bad as I think. Y’know, maybe they didn’t take it the way I meant it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Absolutely! Y’know, because tushie can mean both ass and good worker.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, I just gotta get the thing back!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That sketch you mentioned? Might it have looked a little something like this? (He shows her what he’s been drawing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Joey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is the matter with you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Boy I tell ya, this little talent came in handy before I could afford porn.
(There is a knock on the door and Monica answers it. There is a woman standing there.)

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: Hi! I’m sorry, I know it’s after hours but I really need candy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, I can’t help you. See? (Points to her new sign.) Rules are rules.

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: Please! I have people coming from out of town today! And, I told them all about your candy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No kidding, out of towners huh? What did you tell ‘em?

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: I told ‘em your candy is absolutely indescribable!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Some people have been saying its y’know little drops of heaven, but whatever.

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: Please, can’t you help me out?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Chandler, do we know that lady?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe, isn’t she the woman who lives below you and has sex really loud?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’ll do it just this once! But you can’t tell anybody!

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: Yes! Yes! Please, just give it to me!

content.speaker: Joey and Chandler
content.text: Yeah, that’s her.

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: Thank you.
content.parenthetical: after Monica gives her the candy

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s unbelievable! I-I can’t believe that sign didn’t work!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what would work?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop making candy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But they like it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean they like you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that why you became a chef? So that people would like you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you really want to talk about getting people to like you huh, funny man? (Joey laughs but stops when Chandler turns to glare at him.)

content.description: Central Park, Ross is teaching Phoebe how to ride her bike.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, now just remember everything I taught you and you’ll be fine. Okay? Here we go. Ready…Set…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait! This seat is really uncomfortable! Yeah, maybe before we start we should just get another one. Perhaps, like an airplane seat—or a beanbag chair!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, you can’t get out of this! Okay? You have to learn how to ride a bike!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why? Why do I have to learn?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well…In-in case of emergency.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What kind of an emergency?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well let there—what if a man comes along and puts a gun to your head and says, “You ride this bike or I’ll sh…I’ll shoot you.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I would ring the bell to distract him and then I would knock the gun out of his hand with a Chinese throwing star.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Phoebe just-just get-get on the bike and—Hey! I’ll hold you up and-and push you. Okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You won’t let go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Swear?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I swear!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on. (She gets on the bike.) All right, here we go. All right? (They start.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. Feel good?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, try pedaling.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Does so.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s it, your doing great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Doing great! Yes-yes-yes! Take control! Yes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Weee!!! (Ross pushes her and lets go.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes!! Yes!!! (He starts clapping and Phoebe turns around to look at him and falls off the bike.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Oh! Oh no!! You swore!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I just thought you were doing so well. I…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I am shocked! Shocked!! (She storms off leaving Ross to defend himself from the angry looks from onlookers.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a legitimate learning technique. (Looking around and seeing the woman behind him glaring at him.) Wow!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is making candy like mad as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, there’s uh, some people outside, askin’ about candy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, they’re just gonna have to wait aren’t they? I’ve only got two hands!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Need some help?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! You don’t know the system! There’ll be nobody messing with the system!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: By the way, the week before your wedding you may not see a lot of me. (She glares at him and he quickly makes his way to Phoebe’s room.)
[Cut to Phoebe’s room, Phoebe has put her helmet on one of her teddy bears and is playing around with it. Ross knocks and pokes his head in the door.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hello liar.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I-I’m really sorry I let go of the bike.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I could’ve been killed I hope you know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know. I know. But, can we please try it again? Huh? I mean, you were so close Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I would love to but…the bike got stolen and the police have no suspects. (Ross just happens to have his hand on a sheet that is covering something that suspiciously looks like a bike.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! (Ross rings the bell.) What the hell?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, y’know what? If you are not going to learn how to ride this bike then I’m sorry, I’m just gonna have to take it back.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! Why?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because! Because, it-it-it’s… It’d be like you having this guitar (Points to hers) and-and never playing it. Okay, this guitar wants to be played! And-and this bike wants to be ridden and-and if you don’t ride it you-you’re-you’re killing its spirit! (Pause) The bike is dying.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. If you care enough to make up that load of crap, okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great! Great! (He runs to the door.) You’re making the bike very happy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay Ross! (Ross exits and she says quietly to the bike) Please don’t die!

content.description: Rachel’s office, Tag and her are planning how to get the review back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I think we can get the evaluation back before they see it, but we’re gonna have to get into Mr. Zelner’s office. Now, he doesn’t get in until 10, so he’s no problem, but his assistant, Betty, she comes in early to eat her breakfast at her desk.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: That’s kinda sad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well Betty is kinda sad. Which is why I believe I can lure her away with these chocolates. (Holding up the box of chocolates.) Now, while I distract her, you get in the office.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Got it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let’s roll!
(They start towards the door but are stopped when Mr. Zelner enters.)

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Hello Rachel, you uh, got a minute?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, sure Mr. Zelner, for you anything—minute. Okay. Fine. (To Tag) Abort the plan, abort the plan. (She start to usher Tag out.)

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Uh actually, I’d like to speak with both of you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Uh, well can we, can we get you anything Mr. Zelner? Maybe some chocolates? (Holds up the box.)

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Umm, no. Thanks, but I’ll give these to Betty. (Rachel glances at Tag to say, “See?”) So I read your evaluation of Tag, or to use his full name, Tag Sweetcheeks Jones. Is something going on with you two?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. Can you imagine if there was?! I mean, (getting serious) what would happen exactly.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Well, I’d be forced to file a report. I’d have to consult with the legal department, and your future at the company would be in jeopardy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Uh Mr. Zelner, I’m the one who filled in that evaluation.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no-no…

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah, I thought it would be funny.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: You wrote that you have a cute tushie?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Yes. I have a weird sense of humor, and I’m kinda strangely proud of my butt.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: It’s kind of a risky joke Tag, and what is-what is this drawing I can’t figure out what this is?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re lookin’ at it upside down—y’know what? (Grabs the evaluation and throws it out.) It doesn’t matter.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Yeah, it’s not like I don’t have a sense of humor, huh? Hell, I even enjoy a naughty limerick now and then. But there’s a time and a place, huh?! Unless you uh, have a limerick right now? (They both nod no.) No? Okay, well uh, you’ve (Grabs the chocolates.) got my fax number. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa! I can’t believe you did that. That was really sweet.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: No, don’t worry about it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you could’ve lost your job.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Are you kidding me?! With a cute butt like this, I’d find work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you! You’re great! (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Y’know what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: I feel great. (Rachel laughs) In fact! (Walks over to her desk, sweeps its contents onto the floor and Rachel just glares at him.) What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I… It just—it took me so long to get that desk organized.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. (He bends over to pick the stuff up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There it is. (They hug.)

content.description: The Hallway, Chandler is returning from work to see the hallway jammed full of people waiting outside their door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is going on?
content.parenthetical: asking a man leaning against the wall

content.speaker: The Man
content.text: We’re waiting for the candy. (Yelling at the door.) Bring out the candy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah lady! Give us candy!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s up buddy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Waiting for candy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Get in here! (They head for the door and Chandler sees Smokes-A-Lot Lady standing next to the door and smoking, to her) Hey, and you can not smoke in here! (Takes the cigarette and takes a drag for himself.) (Exhaling in ecstasy) Merry Christmas.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, guys! The candy is coming; I just need another 15 minutes for the chocolate to cool!

content.speaker: All
content.text: We want candy! We want candy now! (And other general commotion sounds.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right everybody! Just be quiet! Be quiet! Be quiet!! Pipe-pipe-pipe down! (They settle down) What is the matter with you people?! This woman was trying to do a nice thing for you. She was making candy so she could try to get to know all of you, and I’ll bet that not one of you can tell me her name! Am I right?

content.speaker: The Man
content.text: Candy Lady?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No not (imitating) Candy Lady.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, if we know it can we have candy?!!
content.parenthetical: stepping in and knocking the man over

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, y’know what? Forget it, all of you forget it! You’ve ruined it! Go home! You’ve ruined it! You’ve ruined it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right, it’s all ruined! You guys ruined everything! You ruined it! (Steps into the apartment and Chandler closes the door.) (Joey struts over to the candy and starts eating it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re welcome. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you smoke?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! Smokes-A-Lot Lady blew smoke directly into my mouth. Eh-uh—are you okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m fine now, but it was really scary there for a while. I mean, someone slipped a-a threatening note under the door.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, sorry about that. Mob mentality or whatever, I don’t know… (Grabs the note.)

content.description: Central Park, Phoebe is now riding her bike with ease and stops in front of Ross. They both giggle.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe it! I did it! I rode a bike! I never thought I’d be able to do that! Thank you Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hey, don’t thank me, thank yourself. You’re the one who faced her fears and ultimately overcame them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t be so corny Ross, it’s not an after-school special. (She rides off and the camera pans down to reveal two shiny, silver training wheels firmly attached.)
